ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Unilateral Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports constant, sudden-onset ringing in the right ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Normal Hearing
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometric thresholds and speech recognition scores are within normal limits bilaterally.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and rule out hearing loss as a cause of tinnitus.
To assess speech reception and recognition abilities.
To screen for retrocochlear pathology given the unilateral symptoms.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation revealed bilateral normal hearing sensitivity and excellent word recognition abilities. Immittance testing indicated normal middle ear function and acoustic reflexes. There were no audiometric signs of retrocochlear pathology or middle ear dysfunction to explain the unilateral tinnitus.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity (0-10 dB HL) at 250 through 8,000 Hz bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 5 dB bilaterally; WRS 92% (Right) and 96% (Left) at 55 dB HL.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal thresholds for ipsilateral and contralateral stimulation; negative reflex decay at 500 and 1,000 Hz.

proposed_items: Use of hearing protection in noise
Consultation for tinnitus management if tinnitus does not improve
counseling_actions: Encouraged to continue with the scheduled consultation with the otologist

escalation.rationale_short: Medical evaluation required to rule out retrocochlear or other medical etiologies for unilateral tinnitus.
